title: Vavpča Vas pri Dobrniču
text:
Vavpča Vas pri Dobrniču (; ) is a settlement in the <a href="Municipality%20of%20Trebnje">Municipality of Trebnje</a> in eastern <a href="Slovenia">Slovenia</a>. It lies in a small valley north of <a href="Dobrni%C4%8D">Dobrnič</a>. The area is part of the traditional region of <a href="Lower%20Carniola">Lower Carniola</a>. The municipality is now included in the <a href="Southeast%20Slovenia%20Statistical%20Region">Southeast Slovenia Statistical Region</a>.
Name.
The name of the settlement was changed from "Vavpča vas" to "Vavpča vas pri Dobrniču" (literally, 'Vavpča Vas near <a href="Dobrni%C4%8D">Dobrnič</a>') in 1955. The settlement was first mentioned in written sources in 1335 as "Amanstorf" (and as "Amannstorf" in 1383, and "Ambtmansdorf" in 1467). The Slovene name is derived from "*Valp(o)ťa vas", literally '<a href="Vogt">reeve</a>'s village', from the Slovene common noun "valpot" 'chief steward at a manor' (borrowed from <a href="Old%20High%20German">Old High German</a> "waltboto" 'ruler's deputy'). The medieval German attestations of the name are based on the <a href="Middle%20High%20German">Middle High German</a> word "amman" or "ambetman" 'steward'. Compare also "<a href="Vavta_Vas%23Name">Vavta vas</a>".
